monthly_spend_analysis_data.ai_summary: Your total income for April was $5,250, and your total spending was $3,421.25, which is 65.2% of your income. The largest expense category was housing (mortgage payment of $2,500), followed by entertainment ($150 for Netflix). You spent $85.75 on groceries, $65 on gas, $120.5 on clothing, $45 at restaurants, $200 on insurance, $75 on gym membership, and $180 on electronics. To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, dining out, and non-essential purchases. Focus on building your investment portfolio by allocating a portion of your income towards long-term investments.

In January 2023, your total income was $5,200, and your total spending was $3,917.74, which is 75.34% of your income. Your largest expenses were mortgage payment ($2,100), groceries ($156.78), and electronics ($199.99). To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, clothing, and electronics. Additionally, explore investment opportunities to grow your portfolio and achieve your financial goals.

In May 2023, your total income was $5,500, and your total spending was $4,841.74, which is 88% of your income. Your largest expenses were rent ($2,200), car payment ($1,500), and clothing ($450). While you spent reasonably on groceries, restaurants, and entertainment, consider reducing discretionary spending on clothing and personal care. To build your investment portfolio, allocate a portion of your income towards investments each month.

In June 2023, your total income was $5,250, and your total spending was $3,037.73, which is 57.9% of your income. The largest expense category was rent at $2,200 (41.9% of income). Other significant expenses were groceries at $125.5 (2.4%), entertainment at $89.99 (1.7%), and dining out at $65.75 (1.3%). To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, dining out, and personal care. Additionally, explore investment options to grow your portfolio and achieve your financial goals.

In February 2023, your total income was $5,500, and your total spending was $3,002.48, which is 54.59% of your income. Your largest expense was rent at $2,200 (40% of income). You spent $226.24 (4.11%) on food, $35 (0.64%) on transportation, $89.99 (1.64%) on entertainment, and $451.25 (8.2%) on other expenses. To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment and dining out. Focus on building your investment portfolio by allocating a portion of your income towards low-cost index funds or a robo-advisor.

Your total income for March was $5,250, and your total spending was $2,653.49, which is around 50.5% of your income. The largest expense categories were Loan Payments (34.3%), Entertainment (6.1%), and General Merchandise (15.1%). To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, clothing, and electronics. Additionally, explore investment opportunities aligned with your goal of building an investment portfolio.
